text: Elizabeth Nelson Adams (January 22, 1941 â€“ March 2, 2020) was an American artist, poet, writer, Arts Commissioner, and movie casting director. She was born in Columbia, South Carolina. From 1995 to 2000, Adams was on the South Carolina Arts Commission. She was on the Board of Directors of The South Carolina Governor's School for the Arts & Humanities. Adams is the author of Gathering the Rain (1990), and Five Malawian Writers: An Essay in Personal Exploration (1987). Adams died in Columbia, South Carolina on March 2, 2020 at the age of 79.Elizabeth Nicholson Nelson Adams (1941 - 2020) == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== Category:American artists Category:American poets Category:Writers from South Carolina Category:American painters Category:People from Columbia, South Carolina Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths
title: Elizabeth Nelson Adams
